alert.note: Alert for Camden; Eastern Currituck; Western Currituck (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 15 at 5:01PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT SOUTHEASTERN CAMDEN AND SOUTHEASTERN CURRITUCK COUNTIES THROUGH 545 PM EDT... At 501 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Grandy, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and frequent lightning. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Frequent cloud to ground lightning strikes. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Grandy around 505 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by this storm include Jarvisburg, Powells Point, Poplar Branch, Spot, Aydlett, Texas, Bertha, Goose Creek, Harbinger, and Mamie. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM EDT for northeastern North Carolina.
